profiles:
Summary I tell stories, explaining the highly technical world at Intel in plain English for 100,000 employees worldwide. The primary aim of this work is to align and inspire employees to Intel's vision and help the company reach our business goals faster. 
 
I enjoy taking complex topics and using creative methods--primarily by writing, but also through video, images, and graphics--and making compelling tales out of them. I love the challenge of staying on top of such fast moving business, and meeting people all over the company that are making it happen. 
 
I've also been a forerunner of using intranet social media tools (blogs, wikis, micro-blogs, discussion forums, etc.) for internal communications, acting as a champion and community manager. I help communicators integrate these channels smartly into their plans, and I've spent years helping employees use these tools to work together better. 
 
Prior to my career shift into communications, I spent several years as a software developer in IT. That background has served me well as a communicator at a tech company, and now has me itching to dip my toes in web and mobile development once again.... Effectively driving direct marketing, PR, product launches, advertising, web, tradeshows, articles, white papers, corporate messaging and sales collateral to increase lead generation, brand equity and sales revenue.

• Spearheaded annual report creation, driving cross functional teams (executives, legal, finance) to meet SEC filing timelines

• Creation and execution of global trade show strategy which increased brand equity and sales opportunities 
• Manage and execute all global trade shows, including all show messaging, product layouts, graphics, collateral, press tours, press releases and equipment (86 annually). Reduced tradeshow expenses by 20% in the first year and continue to drive increase in leads year to year. 
• Vital member of acquisition integration teams to develop transition strategies pertaining to global tradeshows. 
• Strong management skills in cross-functional teams, global internal customers and external vendors, driving faster response rate, increasing efficiency and reducing overall MarCom expenses. Experience Marketing Manager Care Innovations, an Intel GE joint venture January 2011  –  September 2012  (1 year 9 months) Roseville, CA •	Developed and managed the integrated brand awareness and marketing strategy including campaign concept, positioning and focus group testing. Drove the program through all channels including electronic and print advertising, customer-facing website, lead generation programs, social media, SEM, emails, e-newsletters and tradeshows. Established goals, tracked performance and measured the success of the program.  
•	Managed multi-day, multi-location photo shoots to develop our product and usage model photo assets. 
•	I managed Care Innovations’ relationships with our marketing agencies and design firms. 
•	Developed the corporate brand style guide and collateral templates to assure that the Care Innovations brand was used consistently in all external marketing. Converted existing Intel and GE collateral to the CI look and feel. 
•	Researched and established a collateral and tradeshow asset inventory and print-on-demand ordering system with external vendor for marketing and sales. Marketing Programs Manager Intel Corporation - Digital Health Group December 2005  –  December 2010  (5 years 1 month) Folsom, CA •	Successfully launched the Intel® Reader into the marketplace and created an integrated marketing campaign program with changing deadlines and budget constraints without sacrificing quality and/or results.  
•	Received the 2009 Intel Achievement Award--Intel’s highest honor for outstanding accomplishments--for this product introduction. 
•	Developed the strategic messaging platform for the group as well for the Intel Reader product. Applied the messaging across all communications channels ensuring consistent and accurate communication to all audiences. 
•	Created the branding style guide to assure that the Intel Health brand was used consistently and in alignment with Intel’s master brand. 
•	Worked with cross functional teams, geo teams and managed external agencies to develop and implement integrated product marketing strategies and programs targeted at business and consumers audiences. Interior Designer Western Contract 2003  –  2005  (2 years) Sacramento, CA •	Used my strategic and project management skills as well as my space planning, interior design and creative abilities to deliver excellent customer service to my clients.  
•	Provided marketing consulting and training for the management team.  
•	Achieved Sales Person of the Month in my fourth month of employment. Marketing Manager Intel Corporation - Corporate Sale & Marketing Group November 2001  –  February 2003  (1 year 4 months) Folsom, CA •	Developed and implemented integrated marketing strategies, demand creation and promotion programs for the Mobile Processor Group targeted to the consumer and business audiences.  
•	Developed the messaging for the Intel Centrino® product launch, and helped to ensure that the launch was carried out consistently in all channels, worldwide.  
•	Created campaign strategies and worked with a cross-functional team of product marketing, corporate research, brand management, marketing communications, public relations, internet marketing, and advertising as our Geos to ensure that their launch plans lined up with and supported the corporate strategy. Sr. Marketing Communications Manager Intel Corporation - Corporate Sales & Marketing Group August 2000  –  November 2001  (1 year 4 months) Sacramento, CA •	Managed the planning, implementation and delivery of marketing communications programs for the Optical Products Group.  
•	Supported product launches, developed and implemented print and online advertising campaigns, tradeshows, created product websites and print collateral. 
•	Worked closely with the product line to ensure that product positioning and messages were delivered consistently. •	Helped to ensure that the deployment of IT’s products and services resulted in a positive customer experience by bringing Training, Customer Support, and Marketing together to ensure that all customer-facing organizations were in synch. Summary I am passionate about employee engagement and organizational development. My 20+ years of experience at Intel as a HR Business Partner and most recently, Communications Manager allows me to have a view of the most important role of our employees and our company to succeed. I am a visionary and I enjoy challenging the status quo and continuously improve and learn. I am a pioneer in whatever role or challenge comes my way.
